metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5139 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Multiple integer overflows in the opj_tcd_init_tile function in tcd.c inOpenJPEG, as used in PDFium in Google Chrome before 52.0.2743.116, allowremote attackers to cause a denial of service (heap-based buffer overflow)or possibly have unspecified other impact via crafted JPEG 2000 data.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5139` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 52.0.2743.116-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1134
chromium-browser-l10n - 52.0.2743.116-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1134
chromium-chromedriver - 52.0.2743.116-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1134
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 52.0.2743.116-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1134
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 52.0.2743.116-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1134
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '52.0.2743.116-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1134').
